citation.article-title: New species of psychrophilic acetogens: Acetobacterium bakii sp. nov., A. paludosum sp. nov., A. fimetarium sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Acetobacterium bakii sp. nov.
Acetobacterium bakii (ba'kii - L. n., Bakii - named after Friedhelm Bak, who isolated the first psychrotrophic acetogenic bacterium)
Motile by means of two subterminal flagella.
Main lipid complex component of cells is a saturated aldehyde C16:0.
Maltose, fructose, glucose, xylose, lactate, malate, 2-methoxyethanol, methanol, and methyl groups of aromatic compounds and betaine utilized for growth and fermented to acetate.
Autotrophic growth on H2/CO2, formate, and CO; acetate formed.
Psychrotrophic, optimal growth temperature 20°C maximum 30°C minimum 1°C.
pH growth range pH 5.5-8.5, optimum pH 6.5.
Isolated from anaerobic sediment of a pond polluted by paper-mill waste water.
